alert.note: Alert for North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 26 at 5:45PM PST until February 28 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 14 to 22 inches, with 20 to 30 inches along Highway 89 from south of Mount Shasta to the state line, including Snowman Summit. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...South Central Siskiyou County and North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County. This includes Interstate 5, Highway 89, Highway 97, Mount Shasta, Dunsmuir, and McCloud. * WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 4 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down snow covered tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...One to two inch per hour snowfall rates have a high probability of occuring Monday morning near Mount Shasta. This snowfall rate, combined with gusty winds, could lead to significantly reduced visibility and possible whiteouts. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.

area.areaDesc: North Central and Southeast Siskiyou County; South Central Siskiyou County
